alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Castle Country; Eastern Juab, Millard Counties; Sanpete Valley; Sevier Valley; Southwest Utah; Tooele and Rush Valleys; Utah Valley; Western Millard and Juab Counties; Western Uinta Basin (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued October 10 at 2:32AM MDT until October 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible. * WHERE...Rush Valley, outlying areas of southern Utah County, the western Uinta Basin, Millard and Juab Counties, the Sanpete and Sevier Valleys, Castle Country, southwest Utah and the Capitol Reef National Park area, especially Bicknell and Loa. * WHEN...From Wednesday evening through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will warm above freezing during the daytime Thursday, falling back to below freezing overnight Thursday night.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
